relation: The value for the CLEAR attribute.
The other attributes to be included as-is in the tag.
textBeforeTable: Table 181-22 DLISTOPEN Function Parameters Parameters RETURN VARCHAR2; cattributes IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL) cclear IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL, HTF.DLISTOPEN ( Syntax  This function generates the <DL> tag which starts a definition list. You end a definition list by means of the DLISTCLOSE Function. DLISTOPEN Function    <DD CLEAR="cclear" cattributes>ctext This function generates Examples   The other attributes to be included as-is in the tag. cattributes The value for the CLEAR attribute. cclear The definition of the term. ctext Description Parameter Table 181-21 DLISTDEF Function Parameters Parameters RETURN VARCHAR2; cattributes IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL) cclear IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL, ctext
textAfterTable: Usage Notes A definition list looks like a glossary: it contains terms and definitions. Terms are inserted using the DLISTTERM Function and definitions are inserted using the DLISTDEF Function. Examples This function generates <DL CLEAR="cclear" cattributes> DLISTTERM Function This function generates the <DT> tag which defines a term in a definition list <DL>. Syntax HTF.DLISTTERM ( ctext IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL, cclear IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL, cattributes IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL) RETURN VARCHAR2; Parameters Table 181-23 DLISTTERM Function Parameters Parameter Description ctext The term. cclear The value for the CLEAR attribute. cattributes The other attributes to be included as-is in the tag.
